summary: I’m a commercially savvy HR professional with a curious mind and a drive for improvement, recognised for my strategic thinking, the capacity to resolve complex challenges, and an engaging leadership style that helps shape high-performing teams. I have a strong track record of successful project delivery and can develop trust-based partnerships and influence across departmental boundaries, even in high-pressure situations. When faced with dilemmas, I leverage my analytical skills and challenge myself to address underlying issues. I'm an advocate of accelerating the energy transition and empower colleagues to build a sustainable energy future through my work in the Future Energy Leaders network.

Managing People in an International Context

profile_positions.description:
• Led the review of two IM Policy areas, taking ownership for the end-to-end development of new policy positions and the planning and delivery of associated change & engage activities.   
• Provided expert advice to HR leaders and supported IM Operations in applying policies in an employee-centric way, particularly in the resolution of complex exception cases. 
• Built IM Ops readiness to perform large-scale deployments as per Reshape timelines, creating alignment with teams across the HR model and partnering with the IM Leadership Team in setting up an agile delivery structure. 
• Enhanced the operational performance of the Global Outpost Services team while transitioning to a virtual working model due to the COVID pandemic. Later on, headed the migration of the GOS scope into the IM SME team.   
• Seamlessly executed expatriate evacuations, supporting 400+ people in going from 10+ host countries to 25+ destination countries.
• Renegotiated the Outpost website contract, reducing costs by 36% compared to previous terms.
profile_positions.title: International Mobility Policy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Created a high performing team, recognised both for the quality of output and the capacity of delivery. In a year, the team responded to 3000+ queries from 1400+ distinct employees and supported more than 200 redundancy cases and the resourcing of 400+ jobs – doing so with less than 0.5% issues raised by stakeholders. 
• Quickly established a foundation of trust between the two Advisers based in The Netherlands and the rest of the team based in Poland (five people). Fostered an inclusive environment and a culture of safety, ethics and compliance, and data privacy.
• Coached team members and contributed to capability building across BeNeFrux Operations. Shared knowledge in key areas (e.g. managing redundancies). Played a leading role in the implementation of large-scale reorganisations. 
• Leveraged own network to gain a good understanding of the specific priorities of each Global Function, setting goals accordingly. At the same time, worked to raise awareness of the role of HR Advice.
• Founded Future Energy Leaders (FEL) Krakow, championing topics of strategic importance for Shell.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead HR Advice Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
• Acted as HR business partner for Country VPs in Abu Dhabi, Denmark, and Italy. Delivered customised HR solutions and OD interventions in collaboration with local HR Managers.
• Managed complex projects, such as the initiative that streamlined the secondee deployment process in Denmark. Was the PMO for other cross-Shell JV HR projects, including the launch of the Global Onboarding programme for secondees.
• Assisted the UPN Talent Manager by providing high-quality talent analytics and coordinating the rounds of leadership programme nominations. Joined UPN LT conversations related to building a diverse talent pipeline.
• Played an integrator role in the preparations for the 2018 HR Transformation, ensuring that the NOV angle is properly represented and proactively considered in process design and other key change areas.
• Supported the JV HR Forum in setting up the JV HR Community and contributed to knowledge-sharing in the network by editing the Updates, a newsletter with best practices and professional development materials.
• Worked directly with the VP HR Joint Ventures as her Business Advisor on a number of strategic initiatives and assisted in preparations for key internal and external engagements.

Shell JV dimensions: 600+ Joint Ventures, out of which 400+ Non-Shell Operated (NOVs); 2000+ Shell staff seconded to JVs globally
profile_positions.title: HR Analyst Upstream Joint Ventures

profile_positions.description:
• Led and contributed to the review, standardisation, and design of processes key to the Learning organisation (e.g. measuring learner’s satisfaction, onboarding, learning administration processes, learning reviews).
• Gained a thorough understanding of the P&T Learning portfolio and the application of LEAN/ Continuous Improvement tools, through active involvement in the set-up and initiatives of the CI Network.
• Coordinated the implementation of the global External Learning Administration project in P&T Learning, focusing on strengthening relationships with vendors and learning partners (e.g. PetroSkills, NIIT).
• Provided high-quality HR reports and analytics in support of decision-making, while respecting data privacy guidelines and coaching peers on utilising existing data and reporting tools.

Whilst enjoying the dynamic tech world, I missed the connection with the HR space – which is why I took the decision of joining the Shell HR Graduate Programme at the beginning of 2015. My first role within the company was Learning Analyst in the Projects & Technology Learning Excellence team. It allowed me to build on my Learning & Development knowledge while broadening my skills set beyond training/ facilitation, in two key areas: HR process optimisation and project management. Joining at a time of transition, when the Learning function was redefining how to best enable the delivery of Shell's strategy and how to accelerate capability building, brought about an increased opportunity for impact. I made a difference through high quality analytics, leading cross-departmental project teams, and championing change initiatives through a new Continuous Improvement Network.
profile_positions.title: Learning Analyst

profile_positions.description:
• Worked in the Portfolio department to create a consolidated portfolio plan template meant to ensure cross-portfolio alignment in subsequent years 
• Provided support to portfolio managers in planning-related activities, including market analysis, financial forecasting and investment planning
• Collaborated closely with a variety of internal and external stakeholders to implement improvement initiatives in data centres, with a focus on access and security protocols, as well as customer experience
• Acted as an active member of the BT trainee community, engaging in several trainee-driven events

I have an affinity for the tech/ telecom industry, and the chance to work in the field has only increased my passion for it. Though brief, my time at BT has been a perfect introduction into the fast-paced work environment of a multinational company. I have discovered Portfolio Management, an area where innovation and strong customer understanding are key. In addition, being in a high-visibility role meant exposure to senior stakeholders, inspiring people that I had a lot to learn from. This experience has improved my ability to build a strong business case and a credible implementation plan, and has helped me fully understand the importance of data privacy and security.
profile_positions.title: Business Management Trainee

profile_positions.description:
•	Worked in accordance with the school’s curriculum to teach interactive lessons of English as a foreign language to children and young adults
•	Prepared educational materials complementary to course books and used interactive tools such as Smartboard, in order to build speaking, writing, reading and listening skills
•	Evaluated learners on an on-going basis
•	Assisted students in preparing for language contests and passing state and international examinations

The decision to teach English at Lomonosov Private School was based on two underlying factors: my desire to have an active role in shaping the learning process of young adults, and a strong belief that people should have access to high-quality education from an early age (a vision shared by this institution). This activity complements my teaching experience at The Moscow Institute of Linguistics, by widening the scope of the audience that I address. Working with learners from a wide variety of backgrounds and levels of English has allowed me to use and compare the effectiveness of diverse teaching strategies, and has increased my creativity and audience management skills. My interactive approach to delivering educational content has increased the confidence levels of young learners when speaking in English. From another point of view, having to cope with the simultaneous demands of two jobs has improved my multitasking ability and my time management skills.
profile_positions.title: Teacher of English

company.name: Moscow Institute of Linguistics (Московский Институт Лингвистики)

profile_positions.company: Moscow Institute of Linguistics (Московский Институт Лингвистики)
profile_positions.description:
•	Designed, developed and delivered campus-based courses of Management (Business Management, International Management, Human Resource Management), Marketing and British Studies, while leveraging technology-enabled instructional tools
•	Planned and organized learning sessions, and created associated teaching materials
•	Monitored, diagnosed and continuously assessed student progress, and provided personalized feedback and mentoring in academic training
•	Created and led extra-curricular activities such as the English Speaking Club and the English Movie Evening
•	Initiated and implemented a distance-learning programme for teaching English as a second language
•	Attended professional development workshops focused on learning goals and classroom management
•	Provided pro bono consulting services in the field of Human Resource Management for AIESEC Moscow

Working for the Moscow Institute of Linguistics has been a challenging and rewarding experience from the beginning. It has allowed me to develop my cross-cultural communication skills, while being able to apply and enrich my teaching/ training expertise. I was positively surprised by the openness of my students, all Russian speakers, towards having classes in English and solving additional coursework, that would allow them to gain a deeper understanding of the subject at hand. In addition to honing my proactive listening skills, this experience has also made me more attentive to details, and increasingly focused when delivering information.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
•	Created the recruitment strategy and selection timeline for the 2013 edition of Aspire Academy, in collaboration with Harvard professors and alumni
•	Developed guidelines for meetings and effective communication within the Aspire Academy organizing team 
•	Performed CV and application reviews, tracked applications, scheduled and conducted rounds of interviews
•	Provided visa support for international applicants

Striving for excellence is one of my core values and the guiding principle behind Aspire Academy - a programme with the mission of discovering, developing, and connecting outstanding young leaders. As a recruitment coordinator, I've had the opportunity of working in a cross-cultural team and of interacting directly with some of the founders of this project, people whom I admire and find truly inspiring. By collaborating in a virtual team I've strengthened my communication and influencing skills, while in individual assignments I've developed my critical thinking. This role has also allowed me to draw upon my previous recruitment experience from AIESEC and to enrich my knowledge of selection systems.
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• Created and delivered English lessons and organized extracurricular activities for pupils aged 4-14 
• Assisted the school in obtaining the certification needed in order to organize official Cambridge examinations
• Designed and delivered interactive English lessons for a Summer School programme
• Prepared a group of students for their upcoming international evaluations (KET, PET, FCE)

The teaching position at Academic Gymnasium, one of the best private schools in Moscow, was my first job experience abroad. I took this opportunity through AIESEC's Global Community Development Programme (also known as the Global Volunteering Programme). I consider it first and foremost a cultural learning experience. It has helped me discover Russian society and create a network of contacts. Working with very young learners of English while not knowing Russian was a challenging, yet rewarding, developmental experience. It required a lot of proactivity when searching for, combining, and adapting teaching material. Upon my departure I received very positive feedback from my supervisor and several parents. Furthermore, I successfully assisted the school in becoming an official Cambridge examination centre. I wholeheartedly recommend an AIESEC exchange programme to any young person with a global mindset.
profile_positions.title: Teacher of English

profile_positions.description:
•	Provided timely responses to a range of inquiries about customer accounts 
•	Managed existing customer data and contributed to the expansion of the customer database
•	Compiled monthly reports that were used as the basis for managerial decision-making
•	Ensured tool compliance on all interactions with the customers

Computer Generated Solutions is a leading global provider of end-to-end, technology-enabled business solutions, including ERP, CRM, project services, training, and global sourcing solutions. I joined the organization because I was interested in working for a top company that has a consumer-oriented approach to doing business. I discovered a competitive work environment, in which performance, involvement and integrity were core values. This experience has strengthened my ability to use modern information technology to generate and process business information, and has helped me develop my client-servicing and negotiation skills.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Representative

volunteer_experiences.description: Future Energy Leaders (FEL) is a grassroots, voluntary network that exists independently of Shell businesses to accelerate the Energy Transition. We believe that climate change is a challenge that Shell can and has to tackle, and we see our company as a player that can have a large impact. As chair of the FEL network, I work with the Global Board to set our strategic agenda and advise the 20+ local FEL Hubs on key topics enabling their local delivery. I am also the lead organiser of the Global Energy Transition Month, a series of 30+ engagements and activities taking place in October each year, through which we aim to inform and inspire Shell colleagues to want to play a positive role in accelerating the Energy Transition. I’ve been part of the FEL Global Board since February 2020 and became chair in November 2021.

The Aspire alumni community of high-potential young leaders has grown over the past 10 years to 1,000+ members. I actively mentor a few alumni from the Eastern Europe region on career development matters.

Defined the purpose and strategy of the WE Network Netherlands (formerly known as the Women's Network), working together with Shell Strategy Consultants. The WE Network exists to accelerate the journey towards a work environment that offers equal and fair opportunities regardless of gender, thereby enabling better business performance outcomes.

Set up and coordinated the delivery of 14 Mentoring Circles as part of the Women’s Network mentoring initiative. All circles were led by senior leaders at VP level or above, from different business and functional areas. Mentees included staff members of all genders and various seniority levels.

volunteer_experiences.role: Recruiter | Global Volunteer - Teaching | Team Leader | Project Manager
volunteer_experiences.description: AIESEC is a global non-political, independent, not-for-profit organization run by students and recent graduates of institutions of higher education. Its members are interested in world issues, leadership and management. Volunteering in AIESEC Bucharest complemented my studies and allowed me to gain considerable insights into how an NGO operates, while building practical Talent and Project Management experience and worldwide life-long connections.
